name: Aerospike
description: Aerospike is an open source distributed Key-Value NoSQL database. It supports flexible data schemas and ACID transactions.

name: AirFlow
description: Workflow engine by Airbnb written in Python

name: Appdynamics
description: AppDynamics enables you to observe and visualize your full technology stack, from database and server to cloud-native and hybrid environments. This enables you to optimize your applications by managing key business metrics, Application Programming Interfaces (APIs), code-level issues and conversions.

name: Applitools
description: Applitools is a test automation tool powered by Visual AI

name: AWS ElstiCache
description: AWS DB over Redis or Memcached for managed caching solution

name: AWS KMS
description: Key management service powered by AWS.

name: AWS Redshift
description: AWS Redshift is a data warehouse product. It's used for large scale data storage and analysis, and is frequently used to perform large database migrations

name: AWS Secret Manager
description: Secret Manager powered by AWS.

name: Caddy
description: Caddy is used as web server or proxy for many other web server. It is secure and running on https by default.

name: CLOMonitor
description: CLOMonitor is a tool that periodically checks open source projects repositories to verify they meet certain project health best practices.

name: Cloudify
description: Orchestration platform

name: Consul
description: Consul is a single binary providing both server and client capabilities, and includes all functionality for service catalog, configuration, TLS certificates, authorization, and more.

name: Couchbase
description: Couchbase is an award-winning distributed NoSQL cloud database. It delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability, and financial value across cloud, on-premises, hybrid, distributed cloud, and edge computing deployments.

name: Cypress
description: E2E framework in javascript, main competitor is Testcafe.

name: EFS
description: Simple file storage as service out of the box

name: Emacs
description: The oldest IDE, open source that is still widely used.

name: Envoy
description: Envoy is a high performance C++ distributed proxy designed for single services and applications, as well as a communication bus and “universal data plane” designed for large microservice “service mesh” architectures.

name: Firebase
description: Firebase is a full capabilities for building applications. It gives you full support for building you apps.

name: Foundation
description: Framework for front-end development

name: Fultter
description: Flutter is Google's portable UI toolkit for crafting beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase

name: GA
description: Google Analytics is a platform that collects data from your websites and apps to create reports that provide insights into your business.

name: Gitter
description: Community for developers to talk about tech

name: Graphite
description: Graphite is a monitoring tool that runs equally well on cheap hardware or Cloud infrastructure

name: Holistics
description: Self service BI platform

name: Impala
description: Impala is an open-source and native analytics database for Hadoop. It is a Massive Parallel Processing (MPP) SQL query engine that processes massive amounts of data stored in a Hadoop cluster.Impala provides high performance and low latency compared to other SQL engines for Apache Hadoop, such as Hive.

name: InfluxDB
description: InfluxDB is a database based time-series

name: Jaeger
description: Distributed tracing system released as open source by Uber Technologies. It is used for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices-based distributed systems, including: Distributed transaction monitoring. Performance and latency optimization.

name: Jinja
description: It is a text-based template language and thus can be used to generate any markup as well as source code. The Jinja template engine allows customization of tags, filters, tests, and globals.

name: Jsonnet
description: A data templating language for app and tool developers.

name: KEDA
description: KEDA is a K8s based Event Driven Autoscaler. With KEDA, you can drive the scaling of any container in Kubernetes based on the number of events needing to be processed.

name: Krew
description: Krew is a tool that helps you manages plugins on your kubectl, very similar to apt-get and brew.

name: MariaDB
description: MariaDB is a community-developed fork of the MySQL relational database management system intended to remain free under the GNU GPL. It is notable for being led by the original developers of MySQL, who forked it due to concerns over its acquisition by Oracle.

name: Metasploit
description: The Metasploit Project is a computer security project that provides information about security vulnerabilities and aids in penetration testing and IDS signature development

name: Nagios
description:
Nagios is an open source monitoring system for computer systems
. It was designed to run on the Linux operating system and can monitor devices running Linux, Windows and Unix operating systems (OSes). Nagios software runs periodic checks on critical parameters of application, network and server resources.

name: OpenStack
description: OpenStack is an Iaas (Infrastructure as a service) used to convert the existing servers to the cloud.

name: OpenTracing
description: The OpenTracing API provides a standard, vendor neutral framework for instrumentation. This means that if a developer wants to try out a different distributed tracing system, then instead of repeating the whole instrumentation process for the new distributed tracing system, the developer can simply change the configuration of the Tracer.

name: Packer
description: Packer is an open source tool that enables you to create identical machine images for multiple platforms from a single source template. A common use case is creating "golden images" that teams across an organization can use in cloud infrastructure.

name: Presto
description: Presto is an open source distributed SQL query engine for running interactive analytic queries against data sources of all sizes ranging from gigabytes to petabytes.

name: Pulumi
description: An infrastructure as a code platform that lets you write you infra using modern programming language such as Python, Typescript, Java and markup languages such as YAML and CUE.

name: Pypy
description: PyPy is an alternative implementation of the Python programming language to CPython (which is the standard implementation). PyPy often runs faster than CPython because PyPy uses a just-in-time compiler.

name: RabbitMQ
description: Open-source message broker

name: Raygun
description: Raygun is a cloud-based networking monitoring and bug tracking application. It is suitable for large and midsize organizations across a variety of industries and offers crash reporting, user monitoring, user tracking, deployment tracking and integrations with other software.

name: Relay
description: Client library for using graphql. It is a framework for building data-driven React applications. It provides a declarative API for fetching, caching, and updating GraphQL data.

name: Rivery
description: SaaS platform provide E2E solution to ETL pipelines. It is a cloud-based data integration platform that helps you to connect, transform, and load data from any source to any destination.

name: Rook
description:
Rook is an open source cloud-native storage orchestrator
 for Kubernetes, providing the platform, framework, and support for Ceph storage to natively integrate with Kubernetes. This project will help you to manage your storage by yourself without using cloud provider similar services like S3

name: Ruby on Rails
description: Framework for front-end development

name: Sleuth
description: Sleuth is user for Track and improve DORA metrics

name: Snowflake
description: Fully managed SaaS that provides a single platform for data warehousing, data lakes, data engineering, data science, data application development, and secure sharing and consumption of real-time / shared data.

name: Spark
description: Apache Spark is an open-source, distributed processing system used for big data workloads. It utilizes in-memory caching, and optimized query execution for fast analytic queries against data of any size.

name: Spectral
description: Monitor, classify, and protect your code, assets, and infrastructure for exposed API keys, tokens, credentials, and high-risk security misconfigurations in a simple way, without noise.
article_link: https://www.notion.soMonitor, classify, and protect your code, assets, and infrastructure for exposed API keys, tokens, credentials, and high-risk security misconfigurations in a simple way, without noise.

name: Storybook
description: Storybook is a tool for UI development. It makes development faster and easier by isolating components. This allows you to work on one component at a time.

name: Stripe
description: Payment as a service. They are known for their great well designed API.

name: Svelte
description: Frontend framework

name: Tauri
description: Tauri is a framework for building tiny, blazingly fast binaries for all major desktop platforms. Developers can integrate any front-end framework that compiles to HTML, JS and CSS for building their user interface.
article_link: https://www.notion.soTauri is a framework for building tiny, blazingly fast binaries for all major desktop platforms. Developers can integrate any front-end framework that compiles to HTML, JS and CSS for building their user interface. The backend of the application is a rust-sourced binary with an API that the front-end can interact with.

name: Tomcat
description: Apache tomat is an open source project for running web servers.

name: Underscore
description: Javascript library for many useful functionally

name: Vagrant
description: Vagrant is a tool for building and managing virtual machine environments in a single workflow.

name: Vault
description: Vault is an identity-based secrets and encryption management system. A secret is anything that you want to tightly control access to, such as API encryption keys, passwords, or certificates. Vault provides encryption services that are gated by authentication and authorization methods.

name: VictoriaMetrics
description: VictoriaMetrics is a database based time-series

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is NPM library that converts files that browsers can’t understand to files to browsers do understand. All of that with managing dependencies from source files.

name: Zipkin
description: Zipkin is a distributed tracing system. It helps gather timing data needed to troubleshoot latency problems in service architectures.
